content:
Art. 4.84. 
Modification of the obligation to report 
The gift initially subject to report may subsequently be exempted from report by a contract between the donor and the donee.
 A gift which was initially exempt from the obligation to pay restitution may subsequently be made subject to the obligation to pay restitution by a contract between the donor and the donee.
The contract modifying this type of donation, referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2, is drawn up in the form of a donation. Articles 4.249 to 4.253 do not apply to this contract.
The donor may also change the revocable or non revocable nature of the gift by will. In this case, the modification is binding on the donee only insofar as he or she accepts it after the donor's death. This acceptance has no effect on the donee's succession option as part of the donor's estate.
The donation is deducted, in accordance with the rules set out in article 4.154, on the date of the contract referred to in paragraph 3 or, where the modification is made by will, on the date of the donor's death.
